title: New: Fthrsn – Nothing's the Matter // Colors
body: Artwork by [Katai Stienstra](http://www.flickr.com/photos/ancientbeasts) I did two whole Google searches after hearing the new, and only, single from **[fthrsn](http://twitter.com/macklinu)**. I concluded that **[fthrsn](http://twitter.com/macklinu)** is an appalling name, and that there is literally nothing about this unfortunately named producer on the Internet. He did have a supporting slot at a **Zen Tapes** show however, a show which CITR fave **Chrome Sparks** was said to have played at, so if anything, at least he’s in good company. Despite his inability to embrace social media, his new single is actually very good. ‘_Nothing’s the matter_’ plods along with a set of brutal lo-fidelity production, with [fthrsn](http://twitter.com/macklinu) grim vocals, “your love won’t keep me strong”, clashing with the blissful harmonies that float and circle the track. The records b-side, ‘Colors’, is not so full of ideas however, [fthrsn](http://twitter.com/macklinu) voice is weaker with the afro-pop influences coming across more one dimensional. Despite this, the work as a whole is promising. Now if we can just convince fthrsn to get a Facebook, then you’ll no doubt be hearing a lot more of him/her. Nothing’s the Matter // Colors by fthrsn
